title: Brussels Sprouts With Bacon & Pomegranate
summary: The recipe Brussels Sprouts With Bacon & Pomegranate is ready in approximately 45 minutes and is definitely an amazing caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal option for lovers of Mediterranean food. One portion of this dish contains around 21g of protein, 36g of fat, and a total of 592 calories. This recipe serves 2. For $4.57 per serving, this recipe covers 42% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 5 people found this recipe to be scrumptious and satisfying. Only a few people really liked this main course. Head to the store and pick up bacon, drizzle of balsamic vinegar, brussels sprouts, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the balsamic vinegar you could follow this main course with the Skinny Strawberry Ice Cream as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 91%. This score is outstanding. Similar recipes are Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Pomegranate and Bacon, Brussels Sprouts with Bacon and Pomegranate Seeds, and Brussels Sprouts with Pomegranate Seeds.

winePairing.pairingText: Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio are great choices for Italian. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. One wine you could try is Il Molino di Grace Solosangiovese Chianti Classico. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 22 dollars.

productMatches.title: Il Molino di Grace Solosangiovese Chianti Classico
productMatches.description: 12 months between stainless steel, Slavonian oak casks, French barriques and tonneaux of second use.
